title: type used by old Epson Dot-matrix receipt printers?
content:
Hello, but of a fun one for you guys, i think.

In the wetherspoons kitchen i worked in a few years back, the ticket printer had a function where it printed out a test page of all its available characters... i was just wondering if anyone knew where i could find some information on this type? history, origin etc, i'd place the age of the printer at around a 2000/2001 purchase date, although i thikn it's quite an old design, as i think most ticket printers have moved to a hot-carbon type... it's a nice example of primitive printing, and also of low-resolution bitmap type, i'd just like to find some context for it...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110818111149/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture-1_1.jpg) | 56.09 KB |
author: Tom Myers

comments.content:
This would have been "designed" by the manufacturer of the printer specifically for the printer. You can find similar stuff by doing a [MyFonts search for Dot Matrix.](http://web.archive.org/web/20110818111149/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=dot+matrix&itemsperpage=50)

- Lex
